steps.title: Why Not Just console.log()?
steps.content:
When your service crashes at 3 AM:

// BAD The error happened! (When? When what? Where? No idea.)
// GOOD [2025-12-05T03:17:42.193Z] [ERROR] Failed to read file: ENOENT (When? 3:17:42 AM. What? File not found. Which? markets.json)

Log levels matter:

  • INFO: Normal stuff (service started, prices updated)
  • WARN: Weird but working (price hit cap, supply low)
  • ERROR: Something broke (file missing, calc failed)
  • DEBUG: Way too much detail (only in development!)

steps.title: Create Logger.js
steps.content:
Create src\utils\logger.js:

// src/utils/logger.js // ==================== // Simple Logger - Because console.log() Is For Peasants // Provides structured logging with timestamps and severity levels class Logger { constructor() { // Check if DEBUG environment variable is set to 'true' // Windows: set DEBUG=true && node market-service.js // Mac/Linux: DEBUG=true node market-service.js this.debugMode = process.env.DEBUG === 'true'; } /** * Format a message with timestamp and level * Example: "[2025-12-05T03:17:42.193Z] [ERROR] message" */ format(level, message) { const timestamp = new Date().toISOString(); return `[${timestamp}] [${level}] ${message}`; } /** * Log info message (normal operations) * Use for: service started, prices updated, calculations done */ info(message, ...data) { console.log(this.format('INFO', message)); if (data.length > 0) console.log(' ', ...data); } /** * Log warning message (weird but not broken) * Use for: market took too long, price hit cap, supply low */ warn(message, ...data) { console.warn(this.format('WARN', message)); if (data.length > 0) console.warn(' ', ...data); } /** * Log error message (something broke!) * Use for: file not found, calc failed, invalid data */ error(message, ...data) { console.error(this.format('ERROR', message)); if (data.length > 0) console.error(' ', ...data); } /** * Log debug info (only in development!) * Only prints if DEBUG=true * Use for: variable values, loop iterations, detailed state * WARNING: Never enable DEBUG in production! */ debug(message, ...data) { if (this.debugMode) { console.log(this.format('DEBUG', message)); if (data.length > 0) console.log(' ', ...data); } } } // Export a singleton instance module.exports = new Logger();
Read more on MDN:
  • Date.prototype.toISOString()
  • console.log()
  • console.warn()
  • console.error()

steps.title: Create test-logger.js
steps.content:
Create test-logger.js in the root:

// test-logger.js // ================ // Test the logger with all severity levels const logger = require('./src/utils/logger'); console.log('=== Logger Test ===\n'); // Test all log levels logger.info('Market service starting up...'); logger.warn('Low supply detected for iron_ore'); logger.error('Failed to read file', { file: 'markets.json', error: 'ENOENT' }); logger.debug('This only shows if DEBUG=true'); console.log('\n=== Try with DEBUG enabled ==='); console.log('Run: set DEBUG=true && node test-logger.js (Windows)'); console.log('Run: DEBUG=true node test-logger.js (Mac/Linux)');
Read more on MDN:
  • console.log()

Run without DEBUG:

node test-logger.js

Run with DEBUG:

set DEBUG=true && node test-logger.js

steps.title: Test Results
steps.content:
Without DEBUG:

[2025-12-05T15:30:42.123Z] [INFO] Market service starting... [2025-12-05T15:30:42.124Z] [WARN] Low supply detected! [2025-12-05T15:30:42.125Z] [ERROR] Failed to read file { file: 'markets.json' }

With DEBUG:

[2025-12-05T15:30:42.123Z] [INFO] Market service starting... [2025-12-05T15:30:42.124Z] [WARN] Low supply detected! [2025-12-05T15:30:42.125Z] [ERROR] Failed to read file { file: 'markets.json' } [2025-12-05T15:30:42.126Z] [DEBUG] This only shows with DEBUG=true
